data.title: 20 Songs About Mean Girls
data.meta_description: Mean girls have been a topic of fascination for decades, and popular music has not been immune to their influence. data.meta_site_name: Singersroom.com - R&B Music, R&B Videos, R&B News
data.text:
Mean girls have been a topic of fascination for decades, and popular music has not been immune to their influence. From the classic high school comedies of the 80s and 90s to the modern day portrayals in movies and TV shows, mean girls have become a staple of popular culture. But it’s not just on the screen where they have made their mark. Over the years, numerous songs have been written and recorded about the dark side of teenage girls and their manipulative ways.

In this article, we will explore the top 20 songs about mean girls that have resonated with listeners over the years. Some of these songs were written from personal experiences, while others were inspired by fictional characters. They capture the essence of the mean girl phenomenon, from their snarky comments and backhanded compliments to their bullying tactics and social manipulation.

As we delve into the list, we will uncover the themes and messages that these songs convey, such as the pain and isolation that comes from being on the receiving end of a mean girl’s behavior, the importance of standing up to bullies, and the consequences of perpetuating harmful stereotypes. We will also examine the impact of these songs on pop culture and the lasting legacy of the mean girl archetype in music. So grab your headphones and get ready to relive some of the most iconic musical moments that have captured the complex world of mean girls.

1. “Maneater” by Nelly Furtado

“Maneater” by Nelly Furtado is a song about a seductive and dangerous woman who preys on men for their money and attention. The lyrics suggest that the woman is manipulative and selfish, and will stop at nothing to get what she wants. The catchy chorus and upbeat tempo contrast with the dark message of the song, making it a popular dance track.

2. “Breakin’ Dishes” by Rihanna

“Breakin’ Dishes” by Rihanna is an energetic and assertive song about a woman who has had enough of her partner’s mistreatment and decides to fight back. The lyrics describe the woman’s anger and determination to break free from the toxic relationship, and the powerful vocals and driving beat amplify the message of empowerment.

3. “Rich Girl” by Gwen Stefani Ft. Eve

“Rich Girl” by Gwen Stefani ft. Eve is a song about a wealthy woman who has everything she wants except for true love. The lyrics suggest that money can’t buy happiness or fulfilment, and the upbeat tempo and catchy chorus make it a fun and playful song.

4. “She’s So Mean” by Matchbox Twenty

“She’s So Mean” by Matchbox Twenty is a song about a woman who is manipulative and abusive in her relationships. The lyrics describe her destructive behavior and the impact it has on those around her, and the lively melody and driving rhythm capture the energy and intensity of the situation.

5. “Bad Girls” by M.I.A

“Bad Girls” by M.I.A is a song about strong, independent women who defy societal expectations and break free from the confines of traditional gender roles. The lyrics celebrate women who take risks and live on their own terms, and the blend of world music and electronic beats give the song a unique and dynamic sound.

6. “Dangerous” by Roxette

“Dangerous” by Roxette is a song about the allure of a mysterious and captivating woman who exudes confidence and danger. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s fascination with the woman and the risks he takes to be with her, and the infectious melody and upbeat tempo make it a memorable pop song.

7. “Misery Business” by Paramore

“Misery Business” by Paramore is a song about a woman who takes pleasure in stealing her friend’s boyfriend, and the conflict that arises from their betrayal. The lyrics explore themes of jealousy and competition, and the driving guitar riffs and catchy chorus make it a standout track in the pop-punk genre.

8. “B*tch Better Have My Money” by Rihanna

“B*tch Better Have My Money” by Rihanna is a song about a woman who demands respect and compensation for her hard work and success. The lyrics are unapologetic and aggressive, and the dark, trap-influenced beat matches the intensity of the message.

9. “Devil In Her Eyes” by Heavy Pettin’

“Devil In Her Eyes” by Heavy Pettin’ is a song about a woman who is dangerous and unpredictable, with an irresistible magnetism that draws men to their doom. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s fear and fascination with the woman, and the soaring vocals and guitar riffs create a sense of urgency and danger.

10. “Better Than Revenge” by Taylor Swift

“Better Than Revenge” by Taylor Swift is a song about a woman who seeks revenge on a former friend who stole her boyfriend. The lyrics are biting and vindictive, and the energetic pop-rock sound captures the anger and resentment of the situation.

11. “BO$$” by Fifth Harmony

“BO$$” by Fifth Harmony is a song about female empowerment and independence. The lyrics celebrate confident and successful women who are not afraid to speak their minds and demand respect. The upbeat tempo and catchy chorus make it a fun and uplifting pop song that encourages listeners to be proud of who they are.

12. “Femme Fatale” by The Velvet Underground

“Femme Fatale” by The Velvet Underground is a dark and seductive song about a dangerous and alluring woman who can’t be resisted. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s fascination and fear with the femme fatale, and the haunting melody and minimalistic arrangement give the song an eerie and unsettling atmosphere.

13. “So What” by Pink

“So What” by Pink is a defiant and energetic song about moving on from a failed relationship and living life on one’s own terms. The lyrics are unapologetic and bold, and the driving beat and powerful vocals make it an anthem for anyone who has faced heartbreak and come out stronger.

14. “Milkshake” by Kelis

“Milkshake” by Kelis is a playful and flirty song about a woman who knows how to get what she wants. The lyrics use a milkshake metaphor to describe the protagonist’s sexual prowess, and the catchy chorus and funky rhythm make it a memorable and fun R&B track.

15. “Poison Ivy” by Jonas Brothers

“Poison Ivy” by Jonas Brothers is a song about a woman who is irresistible but dangerous. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s obsession with Poison Ivy and the risks he takes to be with her, and the upbeat tempo and pop-punk sound capture the excitement and danger of the situation.

16. “Little Miss Can’t Be Wrong” by Spin Doctors

“Little Miss Can’t Be Wrong” by Spin Doctors is a sarcastic and humorous song about a woman who thinks she is always right. The lyrics poke fun at the protagonist’s stubbornness and self-righteousness, and the blues-influenced sound and catchy chorus make it a classic ’90s hit.

17. “Work It” by Missy Elliott

“Work It” by Missy Elliott is a hip-hop classic that celebrates women’s sexuality and confidence. The lyrics are full of slang and wordplay, and the futuristic beat and infectious chorus make it a dance floor staple.

18. “Stiletto” by Billy Joel

“Stiletto” by Billy Joel is a song about a woman who exudes sex appeal and power. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s fascination with the woman and the allure of her stiletto heels, and the jazzy piano and smooth vocals give the song a sophisticated and stylish sound.

19. “Fancy” by Iggy Azalea

“Fancy” by Iggy Azalea is a brash and confident song about Iggy’s rise to fame and success. The lyrics boast about her wealth, style, and talent, and the catchy chorus and infectious beat make it a party anthem.

20. “Wicked Annabella” by The Kinks

“Wicked Annabella” by The Kinks is a spooky and haunting song about a woman who is feared and avoided by the townspeople. The lyrics describe Annabella’s mysterious and dangerous nature, and the psychedelic sound and eerie melody create an unsettling and otherworldly atmosphere.
